Malaria: Malaria is a deadly disease that affects millions of people around the world. It is caused by a parasite that is transmitted through mosquito bites. Curing malaria would have a huge impact on global health and could save countless lives.

Cancer: Cancer is a complex disease that affects millions of people around the world. It can be caused by a variety of factors and can be very difficult to treat. Curing cancer would have a huge impact on global health and could save countless lives.

Alzheimer's disease: Alzheimer's disease is a progressive brain disorder that affects memory, thinking, and behavior. It is a leading cause of dementia and affects millions of people around the world. Curing Alzheimer's disease would have a huge impact on global health and could improve the quality of life for millions of people.

Climate change: Climate change is a global crisis that is affecting the environment and the health of people around the world. It is caused by a variety of factors, including the burning of fossil fuels and deforestation. Curing climate change would have a huge impact on the environment and the health of people around the world.

Poverty: Poverty is a major problem around the world and affects millions of people. It can cause a variety of health problems, including malnutrition and lack of access to healthcare. Curing poverty would have a huge impact on global health and could improve the quality of life for millions of people.
